questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST appropriate control to have in place after data migration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This control allows for the validation of the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of the migrated data by examining a representative sample. It helps identify any discrepancies or errors that may have occurred during the migration process, ensuring the quality and reliability of the migrated data. Therefore, reviewing representative samples of migrated data is typically considered the most appropriate control to ensure the success of data migration.

choices.A: Review of representative samples of migrated data
choices.B: Clearly defined and documented data migration roles
choices.D: Mapping of transactions from source to receiving system
choices.C: Formal sign-off by senior management after completion

questions.question_text: Due to technical limitations, an organization is not able to implement encryption of credit card details in the customer database. Which of the following would provide the BEST assurance of data confidentiality?

choices.C: Multi-factor authentication to access the database
choices.B: Encryption of credit card details in transit
choices.D: Data masking of credit card details on screen

comments.content: Data masking is effective at protecting data when it is displayed, but there are limitations to protecting data inside the system. Tokenization is more effective at increasing confidentiality because it allows you to safely manage information without using the actual data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Tokenization replaces actual credit card information with a token, protecting sensitive information while still allowing it to be used within the system, significantly reducing the risk of data leakage.

choices.C: The policies are not aligned with the information security risk appetite.
choices.B: The policies are not based on industry best practices for information security.
choices.A: The policies have not been reviewed by the risk management committee.
choices.D: The policies are not available to key risk stakeholders.

questions.question_text: Which of the following issues identified during a formal review of an organization's information security policies presents the GREATEST potential risk to the organization?
The objectives of business process reengineering (BPR) should PRIMARILY include:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Business Process Reengineering (BPR) is primarily focused on achieving significant improvements in performance efficiencies by rethinking and redesigning business processes. While system improvements (Option C) and organizational structure changes (Option B) may be part of the reengineering process, the core objective is to enhance overall performance and achieve transformative results. Incremental changes in productivity (Option A) may not capture the scale of transformation typically associated with BPR.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be the GREATEST concern for an IS auditor reviewing the implementation of a security information and event management (SIEM) system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D
D. Security operations center (SOC) staff have not been fully trained on how to use the SIEM.
Without proper training, SOC staff may not be able to effectively utilize the SIEM to detect and respond to security incidents.

Selected Answer: B
Network monitoring events are an important source. Even well trained personnel cannot compensate for missing data.

If personnel are proficient in using the SIEM, they can still utilize it effectively for threat detection and incident response. However, untrained personnel significantly hinder the SIEM's potential, posing a more substantial security risk.
So , the answer is D

Selected Answer: B
B. Non inclusive of network monitoring events

choices.B: Network monitoring events are not aggregated into the SIEM.
choices.C: Only the last seven days of logs from the SIEM are maintained for review.
choices.A: SIEM rule tuning is only reviewed annually.
choices.D: Security operations center (SOC) staff have not been fully trained on how to use the SIEM.
